definition[0]: (1905–1990), a British film director, who made most of his important films with the Hungarian-born director Emeric Pressburger (1902–1988). They included The Life and Death of Colonel Blimp  (1943),  A Matter of Life and Death  (1946),  The Red Shoes  (1948), and The Battle of the River Plate  (1956). Powell also directed Peeping Tom  (1960), the  controversial  film of a murderer who filmed his victims as he killed them.
